intro: Pentaschistis microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved star-leaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 16,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
